title: Why...
text: First of all, Google is great, I use it on a daily business. But the latest few updates have put me off. Like, how come you're made each webpage have its own bubble, it was much more visually appealing when in was a whole page with lines to signify that it is a new website. Second, why change the image menu when you had it perfect the first time. Whenever I try to tap on it to enhance it, it now shows buttons. The heck am I supposed to do with those? I wish you wouldn't have made it different than it was.

title: Absolute Dog ****
text: This app is perfect if you like slow, difficult to use pieces of spyware. If you hate privacy and don't mind inaccurate search results look no further. This app is especially useful if you're a mouth-breathing, monobrow, burger munching rotten consumer low life. There are plenty of mind numbing erectile dysfunction ads and its like they knew how your latest SSRI was only doing half its job. The only thing this app is missing is an Eagle as the background. I suppose at least Google wears their disdain for you on their sleeves. It's aesthetics with the cartoons and bright colors lets you know grown-up Google knows just how to take care of you so just don't drool on the floor too much, shut off your brain and let the grownups do the thinking for you.

title: Revert to your old photo system
text:
I rated this fives stars to address this issue for the iPhone 10 or X update because that’s all they look at sometimes

I really like the layout you guys got, but when I want to go to the picture tab I can not squeeze out of a photo before the layout change happened due to the iPhone 10 or X, now I have to click the arrow at the top left to close out of a photo which I think limits the apps productivity to be fully functional on the go

title: I love google!
text: The app works smoothly never any problems, it's free btw so no complaints here. Google has single handily evolved the internet as we know it today. With out google it simply would not have such a personal and simplistic feeling it's truly groundbreaking I'm just thankful for google and to have lived in the generation that gets to watch them evolve and take over the Internet search engine game. Thanks google for all your hard work and dedication just to make our lives easier.

title: Never getting this app ever again
text: First of all when you sign up for something, they ask for your information which you shouldn’t put in it because the last time I made a newgrounds account and a few days later someone found a way to hack me and get my information he found a way into my Google account and I deleted everything so he couldn’t get on it again but before that I don’t know what he’s been doing on my electronics. Let that teach all of you Google owners to never give people or websites your information. If you don’t wanna get hacked then use safari. Google is the best way to get hacked or viruses activating on your apple device.

title: Fine as an app, but I don’t like being forced to use it to access simple functions of Google
text:
This app actually works better than most apps by Google on an iPhone, and if you want an alternative way to search Google on your phone, I highly recommend it.

However, I dislike being forced to download the app to access basic features of Google. For example, you cannot access Google Lens, ArVr, or a multitude of other core features in a web browser, you need the app to use them. If you want the Google app on your phone, you are fine; but I don’t really want the app. I would hardly ever use it, and when I do, it does have several bugs on an iPhone.

If this app was just an alternative to Google in the browser, I would give it 5 stars. However, I hate that it is becoming a “replacement”, and not a good one. I don’t know what the profit is from downloading an app, but I hope that Google will bring some of the aforementioned features back into the web version.

Thank you for reading, have a nice day.

title: No more ‘Reverse Image Search’
text:
The very reason I downloaded the app a few months ago was to do a “reverse image search” (searching a specific photo and it’s origin.) I was able to make the searches when I first downloaded it, now it’s giving me general results rather than specific results. 
For instance, I’d look up fan-made art and used to get specific results of the artist and websites where I can find that exact image; now it’s showing me the name of the show rather than results for the original photo I searched. (Gave me the wrong show by the way.)

Definitely going to uninstall since there is no purpose of me keeping this app anymore. Fix please.

title: Nice little app that needs some tweaks.
text: I love my google app but it’s not without flaws. Here are the things that drive me nuts. It will show me stories from as far back as 3 years ago. Minor complaint but irrelevant stories none the less. The hide story feature is kind of, meh, okay. As I read stories I hide them and eventually refresh the app only for them to return... another minor issue. Lastly, if you personalize the app to say, don’t show me this or something to that extent. It can take up to 24 hours for that change to take place.

title: Pages disappear after every update
text: If you’re going to update your app, you should at least make sure the update is going to work first. My newest opened pages have disappeared after the latest update every time I close the iPad down. This seems to be a frequent problem with updates. I also wish the pages would remain until I decided to delete them, and that we could save bookmarks from there. Is there not a setting to change these? I’ve tried to find one with no luck. I prefer the app over opening safari, but I always end up needing to.

title: 2-step  Verification Procees is annoying and I am getting ready to disable it
text: I am getting tired of having to try to login using Google and the 2-step verification process. I have had to attempt 4-6 times before I get logged in! No it is not a password issue as I would get that error message. The message that I get is “something went wrong”. Can someone look into this issue? I know the importance of the verification as it protects you , but come on it needs to log you in the first time!

title: Why on Earth get rid of swipe to hide
text: I did not realize how major of a design flaw it was to not have swipe to hide until it was taken away from me. The extra steps needed are so tedious especially considering the three dot option menu is small and the large list of options makes it so unwieldy. This small difference has made me change this app from a 5 to a 1 and I know that seems a harsh drop but it really is quite annoying every time and has made me stop using the app almost completely. This used to be my most used app before this one small change and I’m really questioning why the developers thought it was a good change, no offense. Please consider putting swipe to hide back please.

title: Needs Some Tweaks
text:
For whatever reason the new update took away the easy swipe to get rid of stories you weren't interested in or wanted to hide and that really bugs me as someone who had really gotten used to that and don't like having to go into a separate menu to make a story I don't want to see go away. 
I've ended up accidentally clicking on them more often than not which is frustrating. 

In general I really wish there were a way to blacklist terms that I don't want to see pop up in my news feed because some posts can be upsetting. The interface is also a bit clunky for my tastes and it can be very very slow to load.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: My son and his girlfriend stayed there over memorial day weekend the first room they gave them the shades wouldn’t close the second room they gave them was full of black mold. The towels in the bathroom were damp. We called after no one was there to check out so we could talk to someone but when we called the woman, it answered, kept talking over us and was so incredibly rude. I would never recommend this place to anybody my son and his girlfriend were both sick when they came home with upper respiratory infections from the black mold, and all they kept saying you have to go to the hospital they didn’t wanna hear anything else so again don’t waste your money

title: Saving images (updated 7/9)
text:
With the latest updates I haven’t been able to save images unless I open a new tab or go to the site that it’s in. This has been inconvenient as image searching is one of the main uses I have for this app.

The app has had multiple updates sense my review and I’ve seen many others with a similar complaint. Except now I don’t even have the option to open the image in another tab making saving an image even more difficult when it used to be as simple as looking it up and saving the image. I’m a bit annoyed that things aren’t improving.

title: No longer works after the update
text:
Since the update , the search bar does NOT work. I tap on it to type in whatever it is that I’m attempting to search , and it does absolutely nothing. I might have to uninstall if it’s not fixed soon. It’s frustrating because using the widget is or now WAS convenient rather than having to open up safari to perform a google search. *sigh*. Please fix this glitch.

Update : since the review , it has been fixed. Thank you 🙏🏽

title: I’m trying to beat me meat here.
text: So this app used to be better, when I was slinging my peeny to some anime girls I could actually make a photo go full screen and easily save stupid meme formats I found. Then a while ago they changed it to act more like you were using google on a phone, which is not what an app should do. When I use an app I want something that feels like it’s been refined to work optimally on an iPhone. And especially when I’m jerkin my gerkin I don’t want to have to stop to zoom into a photo, I want to just be able to tap it. It’ll be fine once they fix what they did but for the moment just pull out a laptop if you wanna slap your sad oceanic animal.

title: This is frustrating
text: I’m so confused, this use to be my go to app but now when ever you tap on a picture in google images it brings you to the website instead of the picture itself. You can’t even look at the picture anymore which I find really annoying (especially when you’re trying to find a image quickly.)Don’t get me wrong, this is an amazing app, I just thing they should change/fix this issue or tell me what I’m doing wrong,

title: It’s good but could be better
text: I have an issue where when I tap an article on the home page it opens a new tab. Each article pressed should get its own dedicated tab. But after three or four tabs that stops happening. Instead the article that I recently opened gets replaced by the latest article. So if I open four and go to open what should be the fifth the fourth just gets replaced. This bug makes no real sense as there no limit I could find about the amount of tabs you could have open. That’s my main issue.

title: Love google! Updates not so much.
text: I love google and use it for everything! However, the most recent update on the mobile app, it took away the push and hold act of the home button at the bottom of the page that directly opens the URL bar. That feature made using google so much easier. Now out of habit I go to press the home button and expecting the URL bar to pop up, it takes me back to the home page instead. If we could get that feature back, it would be so much better!

title: Recommend!!
text: This app was pretty helpful for many things. You can find song names by just singing the beat or lyrics, you can find things by taking a picture and adjusting it, and so much more! My mom uses it, my dad uses it, my whole family does! Recommend!!  Btw most reviews I notice are personal problems and do not happen for others and some may be kids so please don’t just listen to those ones 😁

title: Voice search gets it right...
text:
Then immediately changes it to something else. I want what I search for not what you think I need to see. It's getting to be as bad as apple's voice to text. 

And now I have to complete captchas to search so I downloaded duckduckgo and got MUCH BETTER results from my searches. 

When I switched to iPhone I kept my google services because of the freedom they offered - now they've ruined the entire experience. They took my music app for my PURCHASED music and to use a streaming app that ALWAYS LAGS AT THE EIGHT SECOND MARK, making my library impossible to enjoy properly. Everytime I log into gmail there's more useless crap covering my folders and killing my productivity. Chrome is so bloated that it can eat as many resources as media-rendeering software. Now I can't even search for something quickly, or if I do the useful info is buried under a page of paid ads. 

When google dropped their "do no evil" credo they should've been more transparent that their new model was to be "do no good"

title: Used to be Good
text: The Google App used to be a 5-star app, but in the past couple of years or so it has become slower than Safari, less stable than Safari, and generally less usable. If I open a website from it, it opens slowly, and half the time the site crashes. Same site will be fine on Safari. Google’s attempts to be a news site that knows what you want to read is laughable as well. I just want to search for something, and I’m slowed down by a list of news articles I have no interest in. I hope there’s an update that stabilizes it again. I really don’t want to use Safari. But I’m finding myself doing it more and more.

title: Kirsten Cruz
text: I love the app but here is one thing, to be honest I’m not good with the internet and my husband took away sarfari for some reason and now but I put google on my child’s iPad  and it’s restricted, I asked my husband and he scared if our daughter gets kidnapped maybe make it where you can’t search bad stuff but it depends on what age you are so like this “once you go on the app google asks for you’re age and if young you are able to search up young stuff same as teen etc, love the app though!

title: No full screen images
text: The app is great for researching things or just searching anything but you can no longer full screen an image google has gone back and forth with weather you could full screen an image and where back to not being able to. I like to look for quotes that are inspirational for my Instagram page but I can’t read them easily due to not being able to full screen them. Google images would greatly improve by allowing its usages to full screen an image.

title: New update,no better
text: Don’t get me wrong I love google more than safari. And granted it’s more easy and friendly to navigate. I updated to the 9.10 update and things started to make me mad. First thing my search history was deleted(this doesn’t really happen for me when I do an update) so kinda be prepared to start over, but the worst part is that the app crashes and close ever 30-45 seconds. I  tried rebooting it,I tried turning off my phone and turning it back on again,but they didn’t work. I implore you don’t get this update, this app is barely functional. If you have solutions that would be great.

title: What happened
text: I don’t know what happened to Google but all of a sudden when I search anything all that brings up are advertisements. It doesn’t bring up the Reddit sites or the question and answers sites or the research sites. Just advertisement sites. And sometimes when I type in something it won’t even show anything at all. It only does this when I’m signed in. I have absolutely no idea. I have checked all my settings, nothing is different. I don’t know if a new update screwed it up, I don’t know. But I wish it would go back to normal otherwise I can’t use it while I’m signed in

title: Can’t clear browsing data.
text:
There’s no way to clear browsing data so every time the app starts taking up too much space I have to delete it from my phone and download it again.

I’m really happy with the translation feature of websites and images and that is the reason this has become my main browser. It would be cool if there was a way to translate foreign-language apps without having to take a picture and feed it through google lens.

title: Floating search bar
text:
Edit: They've reverted the changes I mention below. It's back to being a great little news aggregation app.

The floating search bar that was introduced in the latest major release of this app is horrible. It takes up too much space, is too easy to accidentally expand, and cannot be fully hidden. Please revert back, otherwise I'll have to switch to a different app for my news.

title: Great move! Thank you!
text:
Jason, G, and Carlos were amazing!
I cannot say enough about how great these men were moving my items from point A to point B.  They took the care to make sure all if my personal items were wrapped and safe during the move.  They made a very stressful time for me a whole lot easier .  
Thank you!
I will definitely be calling and asking for these men again to help when I move once again to my permanent residence.

title: Terrible performance
text: This app freezes up and crashes more than any other app I’ve ever used. It also heats up my phone and drains battery quite fast for something that should be such a simple app. I do occasionally clear the cache and am always up to date. Performance has just been bad on every top end iPhone since I switched from a Pixel with the iPhone 11. Also things like refreshing the news feed when I’m in the middle of it if I look away for two seconds or recommending unimportant celebrity news no matter how many times I say I’m not interested could use some work.

title: Keeps getting worse
text:
Trying to look up info pertaining to a health situation and the doctors’s phone number and hours. It gives me the hospital info and then just where I can find the info I need, the screen freezes. Won’t let me scroll. I tried clicking on the link you provided in my search and it’s the wrong one! 

I tried a totally different search and I can scroll through tons of stuff. Go back to my original search and the screen freezes again.

I agree with others, every update makes this app more and more unusable. What happened to the Google that made Google the be all and end all? The one we relied on? Now it’s just crap.

title: The app needs a lot of work
text:
Since the Nest app is going away, I’m forced to rely on the Google Home app for viewing my cameras. I have a 4-month old puppy at home and rely on my Google cameras to watch and listen to her while I’m away. The Google Nest Cam has an option for viewing events that include dog barking in the Home app.

However, there is no option to record these event types so I’ll never know if my dog is barking. My Google Nest Hub notifies me of dog barking in the Nest app, so I know she’s making noise. Why have an option for this history view, when you can’t record it anyway?

I’m shocked Google, of all companies, hasn’t figured this out yet. I’ll be returning the camera. What a waste.

title: Mehran Restaurant Arlington VA
text: We went to this Pakistani and Indian food restaurant located in Arlington VA for a family dinner. We were greatly impressed with the level of customer service provided to us. The server took our order and got our food prepared in half hour time which was fresh and sizzling hot. We ordered lamb chops, chicken and lamb karahi with crispy fresh sasmee seed naans. All dishes were really delicious and yummy. Based on our experience at this place, I would highly recommend it to others.

title: Humming to find a song
text: This feature has never worked. Blatant false advertising. Every time I have said “what’s this song?” as directed by the google website, the “search for song” button never pops up as it says it’s supposed to. It just start a google search for the phrase and the google article (explaining how to do exactly what I just did) pops up. It’s incredibly infuriating. I even deleted the app and re-downloaded it to ensure it was the newest version. Don’t advertise a feature that clearly has not been tested. Why would you not just have the “search for song” button within the app?? Great idea with no thought put into the actual design.

title: Google is hitler
text: Google is becoming worst and worst everyday I tried searching on my iPad in safari but it says “CoUlD nOt Do A sAfE iNtErNeT cOnNeCtIoN” what kind of bull is that it works perfect on my other devices but why not on the iPad I don’t get it I cannot do any online game/website on my iPad but on my others, it’s fine uh what? when I try searching a question but the answer is kinda fizzy like hiding it I end up not understanding because it doesn't give me a clear and simple answer what’s up with google Trying to hide everything? it sometimes doesn't get my question right if there's was a alternative to Google better then really good duckduckgo there probably never will be reject google embrace freedom

title: Fixed crashes and allows for dark mode
text: The Google app had been crashing constantly for a while now.  Made it frustrating to use as I had to offload search results to Safari.  Uninstalled the app and reinstalled with the latest version (109) and it has been stable for me.  Also had to manually toggle the iOS system display setting from dark to light and back to dark again in order to get the Google app to go into dark mode.

title: Its been failing more often
text: When I first started using google on my phone a few years ago I had no issues but It’s been getting more glitchy and harder to use to the point I have to re-start the app several times for use now. I’ve tried uninstalling and reinstalling but nothings fixed it. The main glitch is freezing, it usually freezes for 20+ seconds when opened then freezes later and doesn’t un-freeze until I close and reopen. Will be looking for a new search platform, which is a shame, because if it wasn’t for the freezing it would probably be the best searching platform out there.

title: Gets more complicated and less helpful with each upgrade
text:
I should search for what is going on with Google updates, but I doubt I would get any cogent responses since the app goes dark gray when I enter my search. Dark gray. Black hole. 

As well, Google seems to be moving away from transparency, as there are layers and layers of Google settings that must be set or undone in layers and layers of corrections. And good luck finding most of what you need in one understandable UI. 

I think that, in all, Google wants us to live in their alternate Default World....a 1984-esque search engine. Just please make it a search engine. It doesn’t need to raise the dead or teleport us to the beyond.

title: Good, but some issues
text:
The new update has added some benefits, however many things added have also taken away from the older versions. For example, I cannot save any image anymore from the Google app. I have to screenshot the search and trim down the image, which does not give me the image lengths I wanted originally.

The news feature is also very repetitive. Subjects I have no interest in appear more often than those that I do have interest in, and they appear to be the same articles over and over again.

Again, the app is good for simply searching, however many things could be greatly improved.

title: Willard Veterinary Clinic
text:
Me and my family have taken our pets to Willard Veterinary Clinic since 1970.  We have always enjoyed the great care & personable, professional milieu.  Now I travel towns away to be loyal to the practice which has taken good care of all my and my families pets.
Recently I encountered something which to me was unprecedented.  An assistant/( not sure if she was a tech) was pretty directive and I would even have to say demeaning.  As an RN of 30+ years, I was embarrassed for her and saddened to experience this at a business I’ve well regarded for decades.  My hope is this customer service will be improved upon.  In a competitive marketplace, style points matter more now than ever before.

title: This is the Stupidest Update I Have Ever Seen
text: Before this latest update to the search I have never once had a problem with Google and have enjoyed using is as my primary search engine for years. This new update links you directly to a website upon clicking an image with no option to preview it or figure out what website you will be visiting beforehand. There are many websites I would not wish to visit but now have no way of figuring out where I will be going, and not being able to click on and preview images is the worst part, this is terrible. I can’t remember the last time I wrote a review but this just surprised as Google is usually so on top of things, please fix this.

title: I don’t know what I was thinking when the Google man
text:
Talked me in to this Google 1 account and now Google business suite it’s so amazing the way everything is regulated and clean and families enjoying the world so until we meet again I’m gonna go get my name out there  

I own a consulting firm . 🤷🏼‍♂️and hey it just started but it from like me always being g the care taker and losing hard year or 13 months still devastating 

But we out here smiling cheek to cheek

title: Riverview Inn, Cold Spring, MN Retreat
text: Great place to meet up with crafters & quilters.  We’ve been meeting here 4 times a year for 2 years and haven’t had a bad experience, yet.  The conference center is perfect fo our needs.  Breakfast is available and food for lunch & dinner are within walking distance.  Restaurants will deliver to the hotel, too .  If you’re a crafter/quilter, this is the perfect place.  Everything is clean, staff is friendly, and accommodating.  …and a heated pool is available evenings.

title: Completely Frustrated
text:
In the new update it’s promised to be able to search up a song by humming the song stuck in your head. I’ve looked up Numerous ways to get google to record my humming along with downloading the google app on Multiple devices. I do everything I’m supposed correctly with what I’ve read and I never get a result. No one else I know knows how to make it work and It’s completely frustrating. 

I feel it is important for me to also mention that googles search pull up has also gone Extremely downhill along with being very controlling with what pops up with results. If I could give good a zero out of five I would. I’m sticking with bing and don’t feel sorry about it.

title: Security/privacy issues
text: I was using the google app this evening searching for items for my work, and my daughter came in to my office, and asked “Dad, why is your search history showing up on my phone?”  My daughter and I am not on a data sharing plan, and I use my phone specifically for work with additional security, and she’s NEVER logged in to her account on my phone, so it was extremely bizarre to look back at my phone to see her search history on my phone with her google home page.  This is a security problem that needs to be corrected as I’ve never experienced this with any other IPhone I’ve ever owned....  strange....

title: Problem after update
text: I’ve always enjoyed using this app but after the late May update(29th?), browsing stories has become very frustrating. The “more stories” button that’s always been at the bottom of the main page is longer present. As a result, there’s only a handful of articles on the main page to look at instead of the dozens I’d usually see after hitting the more stories button.  Thankfully, I didn’t do the update on my iPad, just my iPhone, and I can still see all the stories on my pad. Hopefully, they’ll get this problem resolved quickly. If so, I have no problem giving a 5 star rating.

title: Crappy Updates
text: Being able to google something seamlessly was a pretty handy tool, but with every update it seems to be less and less efficient. I can’t just see what I searched anymore, it shows me all these links for things I don’t want, when I just want to know the word of the thing I’m looking for. But, the thing that really irks me is google image. I used it all the time and now I can’t even click on an image to look at it... I thought that was the point it just wants to direct me to the web page, but I’m trying to see the picture. I thought that was the point of “google image”... I hope they fix this backwards app it’s less and less functional with each update.

title: Disappointing…
text:
For years, the Google app has been my “go to“ app for searches because of the excellent dictation functionality.
I use an iPad with iOS 16.6 and Google’s recent updated version of the app has made it impossible to use. 
I’ve tried all the fixes, and won’t belabor that here; but when I touch the microphone icon, even though the screen indicates the dictation is being “received“ by the app… NO text appears, and no search gets done.
Fortunately for me, Apple has finally upgraded its dictation software, and even though it’s still inferior to Google’s, I can get by with it.
So… I’m disappointed!

title: Google is My 13th Reason
text: I hate the sanitization of the internet because I would be insulting this decrepit company with words that would made a seasoned 4chan veteran weep. I remember when this url actually lead to a competent search engine. Its all garbage and advertisements now so don't bother wasting your time. I'm actually so livid I had to download this broken app to leave this review because to none's surprise it's impossible to look up where else to leave negative feedback for Google. Congratulations you baby eating millionaires, your monopoly on the search engine market has set us all back ten years. I hope you're happy and that you never see St. Peter at the pearly gates.

title: Search box issue
text: So my my phone update my app and now I can’t click to where I want to type a word or correct it when I use on the search box keyboard and the app won’t allow me to Touch and hold where i want to paste. I’m clicking in frustration because Google is not being helpful in what I want to search and delaying my touch clicking I love this app and I use for everything and it frustrate me to point of either throw my phone or deleting this app when do update and remove feature we love and use all the time
